data.title: Few things you missed about Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan
data.meta_description: Known for his exceptional vocal abilities, Ustad Nusrat Ali Khan passed away on 16 August, 1994. On his 18th death anniversary, here are few things you missed about him.
data.text:
The world today mourns the loss of a great Pakistani musician, Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan.

Ustad Nusrat's birth name was Pervez Fateh Ali Khan, he was known for his exceptional vocal abilities and often acknowledged for making Qawwali music famous on the international front.

On his 18th death anniversary, here are some of the facts about Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan:

advertisement

1. Ustad Nusrat inherited the tradition of Qawwali

He inherited a 600-year-old tradition of Qawwali from his forefathers. Due to his dedication and gifted voice, he went on to become the Shahanshah-e-Qawwali or the The King of Kings of Qawwali.

2. Ustad Nusrat had a great stamina for singing.

He used to sing at shrines and in villages for the whole day night in religious celebrations.

3. Ustad Nusrat has performed at the Brooklyn Academy

In 1989, he performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music's Next wave Festival in United States of America. This was the first time he gained significant attention in the United States.

4. Ustad Nusrat chose Rahat Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan for training at the age of 3

The singer who possesses feathers like Main Tenu Samjhawan Ki and Jag Soona Soona Laage in his cap was chosen by Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan. Rahat's training in Qawwali began at the age of 3 and he went on to sing formally in public by the age of 7.

5. His contribution to the music industry was acknowledged even by the UNESCO

In 1995, he received the UNESCO Music Prize, prior to that he won the President of Pakistan's Award for Pride of Performance in 1987. The UNESCO Music Prize award was followed by the Grand Prix des Amriques at Montreal World Film Festival for exceptional contribution to the art of cinema in 1996.

6. His collaborative work with western artists were a cohesion of the classical and the contemporary.

His collaborative pieces with musicians like Peter Gabriel and Eddie Vedder were some great fusions of his time. These pieces saw the coming together of electric guitar and tabla.

7. Ustad Nusrat was married to his first cousin.
